column4: can I install an old postgresql version (8.3) on Ubuntu 10.04?
What should I add to my sources.list?
I understand, but I have a project that depends on pgsql 8.3 :\
why can it not use a newer version of postgreslq?
fman: Ask the guys in stanford :p http://dbpubs.stanford.edu:8011/doku.php/trio:install
have you tried it with a newer version?
yes, it fails with an error
something like this   ERROR: incompatible library "/usr/lib/postgresql/8.4/lib/triospi.so": version mismatch DETAIL: Server is version 8.4, library is version 8.3. ' in '/* *
well you have two options, either work with getting postgresql installed or compile trio for the latest postgresql
if you would like to isntall older versions of packages, use synaptic
it has full support for package downgrading

All of the sudden my file's names were replaced with ECRYPT_FENK_ENCRYPTED.FWYU-<random ascii characters>.  This happened in the middle of an sftp session.  Does anyone know what might have caused this and how i can remedy this without stopping any services running as the user?
np, btw would u happen to know the cause of my problem?
